clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Assessment of the Effects of Bardoxolone Methyl on Renal Perfusion, Systemic Haemodynamics and Cardiac Function in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease and Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Assessment of the Effects of Bardoxolone Methyl on Renal Perfusion, Systemic Haemodynamics and Cardiac Function in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease and Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to evaluate the variability of several pharmacodynamic measures of kidney function, cardiovascular function, cerebral perfusion, and haemodynamics.

primary_outcome.description: The change in renal perfusion measured by ASL-MRI Scanning

secondary_outcome.description: The change in cardiac function measured by cardiac MRI scanning
The change in cerebral perfusion measured by cerebral ASL MRI
The change in the following haemodynamic variables: non-invasive measurement of cardiac output, heart rate, blood pressure and baroreflex sensitivity
The change in arterial stiffness measured using cartoi-femoral Pulsewave Velocity Assessment and Augmentation Index
The change in body composition measured using Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events and serious adverse events
Change in cerebral white matter microstructure

secondary_outcome.description: The change in total body water measured using Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis
